channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic control lights, 1st August
item.description:
Traffic lights not working correctly staying on red for too long and causing massive tailbacks to Hyde lane and Swindon Road especially as the racecourse road is closed Lights southbound seem to still be on red when those northbound are green - there seems to be no reason for this? This is causing havoc on the roads
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A1, Kingsditch Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: New line markings moving cars to be problem elsewhere, 1st August
item.description:
Cars that were parked on everest road have moved to hilary road and causing massive problems for locals with wheelchairs and pushchairs. Creating pinch points for pedestrians. Totally unsafe

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Everest Road, Naunton, Cheltenham

item.title: BT works on Hucclecote Green, 1st August
item.description:
I understand that BT are about to do work by digging on Hucclecote Green (a Conservation Area). Please confirm that this work has been approved by GCC and that all grass, road and kerbstones will be returned to their original condition.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lane, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Huge pothole on the pavement, crumbling tarmac, and broken cement work near the window which is tripping members of public specially those on mobility scooters., 1st August
item.description:
Right outside 268 high street cheltenham GL503HQ. The issue is been present for last few years. Now the state of the pavement is really bad therefore requires an immediate attention before a major accident.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 268, High Street, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham

item.title: Serious dip/ridge offside wheel, likely to cause accident, 1st August
item.description:
Location approx W3W ///kneeled.afterglow.securing, near layby, on downhill side of Cleeve Hill towards Winchcombe. Hit full on with offside wheels, like hitting a kerb. Very nasty ridge (as opposed to a pothole), difficult to see until you're on it.. As the motorcyclist says in the other report 5 days ago, it's bad. Annoyingly 1 week after I've paid to have my tracking done. Fri 1st Aug @ 2pm.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road causing car damage, 1st August
item.description:
This road and the council representative has stated that it needs reporting to you the whole of Redding’s road from the prefabs onwards until the vets is very damaging and has caused many damages to cars also I understand that bus drivers have complained directly. When will this road be resurfaced as it’s a disgrace and the council member has passed the buck after 4 years of rows
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Reddings Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Bollard shell is damaged/vandalised problem, 1st August
item.description:
